Ok, I finally uploaded the scenario editor DPH sent to me up to the
sourceforge project page. Its available for everyone at
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/?atid=500407&group_id=50083&func=browse

DPH, feel free to get a user name at Sourceforge and post new versions
there if you want.


In related news, I got the pix editor fully functional today. I would have
done it several days ago, but I've been extremely busy. Its not
userfriendly, but it can zoom, skip through frames, and edit? This pixie
editor can be used to edit any .pix file. So any artists out there, you
can have at it :-). Download the latest from CVS, compile, and you're
ready to go.


- Zardus


On Thu, 12 Sep 2002, Daniel Paul Hightower wrote:

> Damn, I found the source of one bug and discovered another one in the
> process dealing with grid names. :-( Unfortunately, that means the
> version I sent to Snowstorm has the 2nd bug in it.  Fortunately, both
> of those problems can be easily solved, but probably not before Friday
>  night.  The first problem can be solved by creating a global array
> and the second by string manipulation. :-)
